ffade7a4-f6b0-43c9-a7e5-9bff423194fb Enrichment operations start at US HALEU plantUS nuclear fuel and services company Centrus Energy Corp has begun enrichment operations at the American Centrifuge Plant in Piketon, Ohio. The company said it expects to begin withdrawing high-assay low-enriched uranium product later this month. Thu, 12 Oct 2023 10:46:20 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Enrichment-operations-start-at-US-HALEU-plant?feed=feed
23b273ad-4328-4472-8343-bc61625dfdfaPartnership to support nuclear deployment in AfricaWorld Nuclear Association and the African Commission on Nuclear Energy have signed a memorandum of understanding to support the economic growth and sustainable energy development of the African continent through the use of nuclear energy. Thu, 12 Oct 2023 14:59:15 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Partnership-to-support-nuclear-deployment-in-Afric?feed=feed
f658f2cc-802d-437c-a115-964d4d2fb57a Construction of fusion materials testing facility under wayConstruction has started in Granada, Spain, of the International Fusion Materials Irradiation Facility-Demo Oriented Neutron Source project. The facility will provide a fusion‐like neutron source for the qualification of the materials to be used in a fusion power plant. Thu, 12 Oct 2023 13:58:53 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Construction-of-fusion-materials-testing-facility?feed=feed
ebf628ea-9784-41f2-ad77-063f4e970601 IAEA staff get access to roof of Zaporizhzhia unit 2International Atomic Energy Agency experts at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant have inspected the rooftop of the second unit and did not observe any mines or explosives, but continue to seek access to the rooftops of all six reactor buildings and to the turbine halls. Thu, 12 Oct 2023 13:26:09 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/IAEA-staff-get-access-to-roof-of-Zaporizhzhia-unit?feed=feed
1ad4db0a-29bd-4aa7-8c1b-4d8ff95d7a51 JEK2: Larger capacity considered, Westinghouse, EDF, KHNP in runningThe proposed new nuclear energy plant for Slovenia could have a power of 2400 MW and there are three technology providers being considered, GEN Energy CEO Dejan Paravan has said. Thu, 12 Oct 2023 11:47:28 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/JEK2-Larger-capacity-considered,-Westinghouse,-ED?feed=feed
a9a55f06-a872-423c-96bb-58b93821f81d Newcleo and Tosto Group team up on LFR developmentNewcleo, the UK-headquartered developer of small modular lead-cooled fast reactors, has signed a cooperation and investment agreement with the Tosto Group to advance the industrialisation of Newcleo's reactors. Wed, 11 Oct 2023 15:23:00 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Newcleo-and-Tosto-Group-team-up-on-LFR-development?feed=feed
fe1335ee-08a0-47cb-bc57-aef23723be44 Rolls-Royce partners for SMR fuel design and analyticsRolls-Royce SMR has awarded a contract to Westinghouse for the development of a fuel design for its small modular reactor. Meanwhile, it has partnered with the UK's National Physical Laboratory to investigate safe automated reactor operation for SMRs. Wed, 11 Oct 2023 14:21:42 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Rolls-Royce-partners-for-SMR-fuel-design-and-analy?feed=feed
ad5d49e1-f382-4141-8faa-5b014d891b2a Mining activities recommence at HoneymoonWellfield pre-conditioning has started as the final step before uranium extraction at the Honeymoon in-situ leach uranium project in South Australia, Boss Energy Limited has announced. It said Honeymoon is on track to resume production by the end of this year. Wed, 11 Oct 2023 11:53:41 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Mining-activities-recommence-at-Honeymoon?feed=feed
75af9434-7d0e-48c0-a9b3-584e711c5a8d Myanmar and Russia sign nuclear infrastructure MoUDetermining the nuclear infrastructure development needs for Myanmar and identifying priority areas of work for the development of a small modular reactor project were the subject of a fresh memorandum of understanding signed with Russia. Wed, 11 Oct 2023 13:51:54 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Myanmar-and-Russia-sign-nuclear-infrastructure-MoU?feed=feed
5bc7ea50-07a5-491f-955f-92e630fadad9 TVO eyes extended, expanded use of Olkiluoto unitsFinnish utility Teollisuuden Voima Oyj announced it has initiated an environmental impact assessment procedure for a possible operating licence extension and potential power uprating of units 1 and 2 at its Olkiluoto nuclear power plant. Tue, 10 Oct 2023 12:09:39 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/TVO-eyes-extended,-expanded-use-of-Olkiluoto-units?feed=feed
520a5e51-cc12-49aa-a1df-8d63d4b79eba Complete dismantling of experimental French reactor to proceedEDF has been authorised to begin the third and final phase of the decommissioning of the Brennilis nuclear power plant in the Monts d'Arée in Brittany, France. The plant is a unique 75 MWe gas-cooled heavy water reactor that operated between 1972 and 1981. Tue, 10 Oct 2023 15:08:55 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Complete-dismantling-of-experimental-French-reacto?feed=feed
